Claim: A Chinese pirate movie called “Coronavirus” is sold in Mexico City.
Explaination: The video is actually a 2013 South Korean film called Gamgi.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Chinese pirate movie called “Coronavirus” is sold in Mexico City.

Explanation:The video is actually a 2013 South Korean film called Gamgi.

https://spondeomedia.com/falso-pelicula-asiatica-sobre-el-coronavirus/

Claim: Doctors said the entire Wuhan population will die of the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: Authorities never said that and US CDC said most people will recover on their own.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Doctors said the entire Wuhan population will die of the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:Authorities never said that and US CDC said most people will recover on their own.

http://u.afp.com/34jV
ann02_remarks: It could also be "community spread and impact" but annotation guidelines do not include guides as to what is meant by "impact" - only about spread.

Claim: COVID-19 Breeds Rapidly In Toilet Paper.
Explaination: Post claiming COVID-19 breeds rapidly in toilet paper is fake. The post is taken from an inauthentic website.
Label: False
html:
Claim: COVID-19 Breeds Rapidly In Toilet Paper.

Explanation:Post claiming COVID-19 breeds rapidly in toilet paper is fake. The post is taken from an inauthentic website.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-post-claiming-covid-19-breeds-rapidly-in-toilet-paper-is-fake/

Claim: Video allegedly exposing coronavirus’s secrets.
Explaination: From the CDC to doctors to international reports, none of the claims can be backed up with evidence.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video allegedly exposing coronavirus’s secrets.

Explanation:From the CDC to doctors to international reports, none of the claims can be backed up with evidence.

https://leadstories.com/cgi-bin/mt/mt-search.cgi?search=coronavirus&IncludeBlogs=1&blog_id=1&limit=10&page=3

Claim: Facebook posts shared thousands of times feature a video of U.S. officials talking to reporters, with captions claiming they are announcing the arrest of a Chinese scientist.
Explaination: However, the footage has nothing to do with COVID-19 and scientists have refuted allegations the virus was deliberately created.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Facebook posts shared thousands of times feature a video of U.S. officials talking to reporters, with captions claiming they are announcing the arrest of a Chinese scientist.

Explanation:However, the footage has nothing to do with COVID-19 and scientists have refuted allegations the virus was deliberately created.

https://factcheck.afp.com/facebook-posts-falsely-claim-us-arrested-chinese-scientist-who-created-coronavirus

Claim: Research made by scientists from the University of Queensland in Australia has proven that bananas improve your immune system and help prevent COVID-19.
Explaination: The University of Queensland dismissed the claim as false. In an email to Rappler, the university’s communication team said: “The video is fake and we would strongly discourage people from sharing this information. We would suggest you share your concerns with the social media platforms.”
Label: False
html:
Claim: Research made by scientists from the University of Queensland in Australia has proven that bananas improve your immune system and help prevent COVID-19.

Explanation:The University of Queensland dismissed the claim as false. In an email to Rappler, the university’s communication team said: “The video is fake and we would strongly discourage people from sharing this information. We would suggest you share your concerns with the social media platforms.”

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/254883-video-bananas-prevent-coronavirus

Claim: Italy’s Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke down publicly due to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The image viral on social media is of Brazilian President Bolsonaro and not of Italy's PM Giuseppe Conte. The claim shared by several Social media users and media outlets is hence false.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italy’s Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte broke down publicly due to the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The image viral on social media is of Brazilian President Bolsonaro and not of Italy's PM Giuseppe Conte. The claim shared by several Social media users and media outlets is hence false.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15335640

Claim: Industrialist Ratan Tata’s view on economic downfall due to COVID-19.
Explaination: The quote on economical downfall due to COVID-19 is falsely attributed to Ratan Tata.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Industrialist Ratan Tata’s view on economic downfall due to COVID-19.

Explanation:The quote on economical downfall due to COVID-19 is falsely attributed to Ratan Tata.

Claim: Several photographs published on Facebook claim to portray coffins with victims of the new coronavirus in Italy.
Explaination: The pictures were taken in april 2009, after an earthquake in L'Aquila, that killed 308 people.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Several photographs published on Facebook claim to portray coffins with victims of the new coronavirus in Italy.

Explanation:The pictures were taken in april 2009, after an earthquake in L'Aquila, that killed 308 people.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-fotografias-com-dezenas-de-caixoes-alinhados-sao-de-mortos-por-coronavirus-em-italia/

Claim: Says video shows “the Chinese are destroying the 5G poles as they are aware that it is the thing triggering the corona symptoms.”
Explaination: The video shows Hong Kong protesters tearing down “smart” lampposts because they feared they could be used to collect personal data from citizens.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Says video shows “the Chinese are destroying the 5G poles as they are aware that it is the thing triggering the corona symptoms.”

Explanation:The video shows Hong Kong protesters tearing down “smart” lampposts because they feared they could be used to collect personal data from citizens.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/viral-image/no-video-doesnt-show-people-china-destroying-5g-po/

Claim: This video shows panic buying in the United States, during the coronavirus outbreak
Explaination: But the video has been shared in a misleading context; it has circulated online since November 2019, weeks before the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.
Label: False
html:
Claim: This video shows panic buying in the United States, during the coronavirus outbreak

Explanation:But the video has been shared in a misleading context; it has circulated online since November 2019, weeks before the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-has-circulated-online-november-2019-weeks-covid-19-outbreak

Claim: Fire triggered by gas tanker leak near Delhi’s Shahdara Mor.
Explaination: Video is not from Delhi but Lahore's Shahdara Mor in Pakistan.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Fire triggered by gas tanker leak near Delhi’s Shahdara Mor.

Explanation:Video is not from Delhi but Lahore's Shahdara Mor in Pakistan.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-was-this-major-accident-averted-due-to-lockdown-in-delhi-1-1175380.html

Claim: Australian researchers have found that bananas can help prevent infection of COVID-19.
Explaination: We found the post to be False. There is no proof that banana can boost one’s immune system and prevent the disease caused by coronavirus. At present there are no medicines to cure COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Australian researchers have found that bananas can help prevent infection of COVID-19.

Explanation:We found the post to be False. There is no proof that banana can boost one’s immune system and prevent the disease caused by coronavirus. At present there are no medicines to cure COVID-19.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/18/fact-check-australian-researchers-have-found-that-bananas-can-help-prevent-an-infection-of-covid-19/

Claim: Can cannabis cure coronavirus?
Explaination: The image has been created with the help of a website called dopl3r. No government mandate or science research or WHO have commented on cannabis and if it can cure coronavirus or not.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Can cannabis cure coronavirus?

Explanation:The image has been created with the help of a website called dopl3r. No government mandate or science research or WHO have commented on cannabis and if it can cure coronavirus or not.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_14792103

Claim: American citizens have placed a nude statue of President Donald Trump in New York City because he failed to handle the coronavirus situation in USA.
Explaination: The video is almost 4 years old and is unrelated to the current Novel coronavirus situation.
Label: False
html:
Claim: American citizens have placed a nude statue of President Donald Trump in New York City because he failed to handle the coronavirus situation in USA.

Explanation:The video is almost 4 years old and is unrelated to the current Novel coronavirus situation.

Claim: An audio clip of Dr. Naresh Trehan cautioning people about the danger of COVID-19 in India.
Explaination: The audio is not of Dr. Trehan, nor has he ever said what is said in this audio recording.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An audio clip of Dr. Naresh Trehan cautioning people about the danger of COVID-19 in India.

Explanation:The audio is not of Dr. Trehan, nor has he ever said what is said in this audio recording.

Claim: NY banned cigarette sales because of the coronavirus.
Explaination: Gov. Andrew Cuomo's team told Lead Stories that he is not about to announce a six-week ban on cigarette sales to help curb the death rate from COVID-19, which has devastated the state.
Label: False
html:
Claim: NY banned cigarette sales because of the coronavirus.

Explanation:Gov. Andrew Cuomo's team told Lead Stories that he is not about to announce a six-week ban on cigarette sales to help curb the death rate from COVID-19, which has devastated the state.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-15.html

Claim: A video of a girl collapsing in a store because she was affected by coronavirus.
Explaination: Incident is from Malaysia and the girl has been identified as Nur Izzah Izzati. Malaysia’s Health Ministry also confirmed that the claim attached with the video is fake.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video of a girl collapsing in a store because she was affected by coronavirus.

Explanation:Incident is from Malaysia and the girl has been identified as Nur Izzah Izzati. Malaysia’s Health Ministry also confirmed that the claim attached with the video is fake.

http://newsmobile.in/articles/2020/01/30/fact-check-the-girl-in-the-viral-video-did-not-die-because-of-coronavirus/

Claim: In Japan, “It’s the Democratic party’s fault that health insurance system is abused by foreigners”
Explaination: According to Japan Tourism Agency, this information is false.
Label: False
html:
Claim: In Japan, “It’s the Democratic party’s fault that health insurance system is abused by foreigners”

Explanation:According to Japan Tourism Agency, this information is false.

Claim: Research by the Saint Luke’s Hospital of Kansas City found that consuming alcoholic beverages may reduce the risk of infection by coronavirus. Vodka was the most recommended drink.
Explaination: The hospital dismissed the claim as false. Further, the World Health Organization (WHO) does not recommend alcohol consumption to prevent the coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Research by the Saint Luke’s Hospital of Kansas City found that consuming alcoholic beverages may reduce the risk of infection by coronavirus. Vodka was the most recommended drink.

Explanation:The hospital dismissed the claim as false. Further, the World Health Organization (WHO) does not recommend alcohol consumption to prevent the coronavirus.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/254434-alcoholic-drinks-reduce-coronavirus-risk

Claim: Picture shows the Mecca totally empty.
Explaination: The picture is from a miniature designed by an artist.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Picture shows the Mecca totally empty.

Explanation:The picture is from a miniature designed by an artist.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200313-coronavirus-intox-monde-arabe-observateurs-mecque-saddam-hussein?check=1

Claim: This photo shows a Sri Lankan airline pilot who tested positive for the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; the local health authority told AFP the pilot is not pictured in the photo; the man wrongly identified in the posts denied the claim.
Label: False
html:
Claim: This photo shows a Sri Lankan airline pilot who tested positive for the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; the local health authority told AFP the pilot is not pictured in the photo; the man wrongly identified in the posts denied the claim.

https://factcheck.afp.com/photo-does-not-show-pilot-who-tested-positive-after-visiting-cricket-game-sri-lanka

Claim: [SARS-CoV-2] is spreading quickly from gas pumps. Shopping carts as well.
Explaination: People may become infected by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which causes COVID-19, when they touch contaminated surfaces and transfer the virus to their eyes, nose, or mouth. However, it is not known how often this is likely to occur and there is no evidence that it is spreading quickly in this manner. Therefore, proper handwashing and cleaning surfaces with soap or other common disinfectants are effective ways to reduce the risk of contracting the virus from surfaces.
Label: Partially correct
html:
Claim: [SARS-CoV-2] is spreading quickly from gas pumps. Shopping carts as well.

Explanation:People may become infected by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which causes COVID-19, when they touch contaminated surfaces and transfer the virus to their eyes, nose, or mouth. However, it is not known how often this is likely to occur and there is no evidence that it is spreading quickly in this manner. Therefore, proper handwashing and cleaning surfaces with soap or other common disinfectants are effective ways to reduce the risk of contracting the virus from surfaces.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/the-virus-that-causes-covid-19-can-survive-on-solid-surfaces-for-days-but-infection-risk-from-contaminated-objects-is-unknown/

Claim: If Florida banned alcohol sales due to coronavirus.
Explaination: Story came from a prank news generator.
Label: False
html:
Claim: If Florida banned alcohol sales due to coronavirus.

Explanation:Story came from a prank news generator.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/Fact-Check-Florida-Did-NOT-Ban-Alcohol-Sales-Beginning-Today.html

Claim: Posts circulating on social media claim that Ugandan and Kenyan authorities have instructed landlords to stop collecting rent due to the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false; the countries have issued public guidance amid the pandemic, but there has been no official communication on rent payments and government officials dismissed the reports.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Posts circulating on social media claim that Ugandan and Kenyan authorities have instructed landlords to stop collecting rent due to the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false; the countries have issued public guidance amid the pandemic, but there has been no official communication on rent payments and government officials dismissed the reports.

https://factcheck.afp.com/ugandan-and-kenyan-authorities-reject-claims-they-told-landlords-stop-rent-collection
